summary: REQ-52 is partially implemented: taskSort.ts adds an assignee sort field and sorting case, but the null/empty-string behavior for assignedName and the TasksPage UI wiring cannot be fully verified from the truncated diff. There are also unrequested metadata/documentation updates.

missing_requirements.requirement: sortTasks() can sort by assignedName using the existing null-safe, case-insensitive string comparison behavior, with tasks with missing/empty assignedName sorting to the end.
missing_requirements.reason: The implemented compareValues() only pushes null/undefined to the end; empty strings ("") are treated as valid values and would sort before non-empty names, violating the 'missing/empty sorts to the end' requirement unless empty values are represented as null/undefined upstream (not shown).

missing_requirements.requirement: In TasksPage.tsx, the "Sort by" Select includes an option for the new assignee sort field, and selecting it updates the rendered task ordering accordingly.
missing_requirements.reason: TasksPage.tsx is truncated before the sorting Select rendering and before any sortTasks() invocation/wiring is shown, so the presence of the new SelectItem option and the state-to-sorting behavior cannot be confirmed from the provided diff summary.

hallucinated_features.description: Updates to project metadata/state and file summary documentation not requested as part of REQ-52.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks for client-side sorting changes on the Tasks page; modifying project_state.json and frontend-file-summaries.txt is not part of the stated requirements.
